program_information.country: Multiple (Bangladesh, Ethiopia, Ghana, India, Pakistan, Peru, Honduras)
program_information.target_population: Extremely poor households living on less than 70 cents per day
program_information.program_name_citation: The programme tested in the study uses the 'graduation model', which aims to graduate people out of extreme poverty. It was invented in Dhaka by the Bangladesh Rural Advancement Committee (BRAC)
program_information.country_citation: the results of an experiment involving more than 10,000 households in 6 countries... successful in Ethiopia, Ghana, India, Pakistan and Peru, it failed in Honduras
program_information.target_population_citation: More than 1 billion people in the world live on less than US$1.25 per day, but the graduation model targets the hundreds of millions who live on less than 70 cents per day. These people are mostly rural women and slum dwellers who are often dependent on aid to survive.

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: Giving some of the world's poorest people a two-year aid package -including cash, food, health-care services, training and advice

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: Households were given assets such as goats, sheep or chickens to start farming, or the means to open a shop

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Overall, one year after the intervention stopped, the experiment had produced a 14% increase in assets and a 96% increase in savings
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: the work was done as a randomized controlled trial in which people were randomly assigned to either an intervention or a control group

bonus_information.cost_mentions: Costs per household ranged from $1,455 in India to $5,962 in Pakistan, with positive returns on investment ranging from 133% in Ghana to 433% in India
bonus_information.cost_evidence_citation: Costs per household ranged from $1,455 in India to $5,962 in Pakistan, although they were offset by positive returns on investment ranging from 133% in Ghana to 433% in India
